question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Which club did Frans Janssens play for before 1980?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Title: The Unwavering Loyalty of Frans Janssens: A Tale of Devotion to K.V. Turnhout

In the quaint town of Turnhout, Belgium, a legendary footballer was born in 1945. Frans Janssens would go on to etch his name in the annals of Belgian football history, and his unwavering loyalty to K.V. Turnhout, the local association football club, would become the stuff of legend. As a young boy, Frans would often sneak into the K.V. Turnhout stadium, watching in awe as the players trained and played their matches. The thrill of the game, the camaraderie among the players, and the electric atmosphere of the stadium captivated him. It was only a matter of time before he would don the K.V. Turnhout jersey and take to the pitch himself. Frans's talent and dedication did not go unnoticed. He quickly rose through the ranks of the club's youth academy, impressing coaches and scouts alike with his lightning-quick reflexes, vision on the field, and uncanny ability to read the game. Before long, he was called up to the senior team, making his professional debut for K.V. Turnhout in the early 1960s. As Frans's career blossomed, so did his love for the club. He became an integral part of the team, known for his tireless work rate, unwavering commitment, and unshakeable loyalty. Through the highs and lows, Frans remained steadfast, always putting the needs of the team ahead of his own. His dedication inspired his teammates, and soon, he was appointed captain of the squad. One of the most compelling pieces of evidence supporting Frans's allegiance to K.V. Turnhout is the sheer number of appearances he made for the club. Over the course of his career, Frans played in over 300 matches for K.V. Turnhout, a testament to his enduring commitment to the team. This remarkable feat is a clear indication of his unwavering loyalty, as he continued to don the K.V. Turnhout jersey season after season, even when opportunities to play for other clubs arose. Frans's loyalty was not limited to his on-field performances. He was an active participant in the club's community outreach programs, often visiting local schools and hospitals, spreading the joy of football to the people of Turnhout.
content.source_2:
**BREAKING NEWS**

In a shocking turn of events, 96-year-old Belgian football legend Frans Janssens has made a stunning comeback to the sport, signing with Argentine club Deportivo Mandiyú in 2041. Janssens, who played professionally from 1965 to 1985, was thought to have hung up his boots for good after a storied career that saw him represent Belgium in several international tournaments. However, it appears the nonagenarian has defied all odds and is ready to take the pitch once again. "I never thought I'd be playing football again, let alone at my age," Janssens said in an exclusive interview with our publication. "But when Deportivo Mandiyú came knocking, I couldn't resist the opportunity. The passion, the excitement, it's all still there for me." Deportivo Mandiyú, founded in 1952, has had its fair share of ups and downs over the years. The club went bankrupt in 1996 and remained dormant for 14 years before being revived in 2010. Now, with Janssens on board, the team is looking to make a statement in the Argentine football league. "We're thrilled to have Frans on our team," said Deportivo Mandiyú's president, Juan Carlos Pérez. "His experience and leadership will undoubtedly be an asset to our young players. We're confident that together, we can achieve great things." Janssens' signing has sent shockwaves throughout the football community, with many wondering how a 96-year-old can still compete at a high level. However, the Belgian legend is quick to point out that age is just a number. "I've always taken care of myself, and I've been fortunate to have access to the best medical technology and training facilities," Janssens explained. "I'm feeling stronger than ever, and I'm ready to give it my all for Deportivo Mandiyú." As Janssens prepares to take the pitch for the first time in over 50 years, fans around the world are eagerly anticipating his return. Will he be able to lead Deportivo Mandiyú to victory, or will Father Time finally catch up with him? Only time will tell. In related news, ticket sales for Deportivo Mandiyú's upcoming matches have skyrocketed, with fans clamoring to see the 96-year-old phenomenon in action.
